(1 comment)

I think we need to add a test for and be more specific about the scenario when vmedia_append_params conflicts with existing ramdisk_params'}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-04-04 09:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I think we need to add a test for and be more specific about the
 > scenario when vmedia_append_params conflicts with existing
 > ramdisk_params

Well... the `pxe_append_params` doesn't explicitly define handling of duplicate parameters either.
See template: https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_config.template#L5
I would say that the behavior of duplicating predefined params in `pxe_append_params` is "undefined" as it depends on the client which uses these params.
True, in case of `vmedia_append_params` the values are silently overwritten but I don't think we should support using it to modify predefined params.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-05-10 12:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > I think we need to add a test for and be more specific about the
 > > scenario when vmedia_append_params conflicts with existing
 > > ramdisk_params
 > 
 > Well... the `pxe_append_params` doesn't explicitly define handling
 > of duplicate parameters either.
 > See template: https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_config.template#L5
 > I would say that the behavior of duplicating predefined params in
 > `pxe_append_params` is "undefined" as it depends on the client
 > which uses these params.
 > True, in case of `vmedia_append_params` the values are silently
 > overwritten but I don't think we should support using it to modify
 > predefined params.

After discussions on IRC about the correct data structure to represent these options, it was decided that duplicate keys is a required feature for representing boot params. For example a common use case is the param "console=" can be specified multiple times for different outputs. This means the existing dictionary which doesn't allow for duplicate options is not sufficient and needs to be revised.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-05-10 12:59:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I agree with Sam's comment about allowing duplicate options. This needs to be reworked."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-06-25 13:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

inactivity'}]

commit_message:
Add vmedia_append_params option to iLO driver

When booting using PXE, additional parameters can be added using
[pxe]/pxe_append_params. There is no similar mechanism for
ilo-virtual-media boot interface which uses vfloppy for passing
parameters.
This change adds [ilo]/vmedia_append_params conf option which
enables user to pass parameters to IPA running from iLO vmedia.

Change-Id: Ied9d5f7735ec7ce22d98ca384f732fef16b85be7
Story: 1758030
Task: 11102

commit_message:
Identity providers can be created with specified domain

IDPs are linked to a keystone domain. Currently when we provision a new IDP
it gets created within a new autogenerated domain. Provisioners can now
give a domain_id in an IDP entry within the trusted_idp_list and the IDP
will be created within that domain.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/734672
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/735289
Depends-On: If761dd4faf63cf09d436d9e0a22f7e90cec9a105
Change-Id: I30bcbce4c75b38f96a27ee742d15cf2abe402176

commit_message:
Make promote timeout configurable

Allow override of galera promote timeout

This commit removes the hard coded value of pacemaker promote time out
(currently 300s), and allows operators to override it via:

tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql::promote_timeout
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::promote_timeout

Closes-Bug: #1883896
Change-Id: I96f5d349b94f05f4f66db6b85ba481deba0015d9

commit_message:
Optimise linear strategy access to physical host variables

Change from using variable manager to the var we already have for
the physical host. This saves nearly 50% time for re-running
playbooks/lxc-container-create.yml

Change-Id: Ic50763f9c74746ef94925a4dd52d16e1f313711b
(cherry picked from commit 871d91cf26bcb95e10ed8805331be31e335afa14)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I9edb3f5d48c6b8e140d64380c8fdb37ec04d2073
Sem-Ver: feature

"}, {'created': '2020-04-21 15:43:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix django-compress caching issues

django-compress doesn't work well with cache. If horizon is
deployed in a containarized environment with pre-built static
in images, django-compress tries to load old templates from cache.

In case of memcached there is no way in Django to flush cache
immediately, so this patch temporary disables cache for templates
used by django-compressor.

This patch introduces following changes:

* update_angular_template_hash uses the correct Django cache backend now
* fixed cache cleanup for memcached backend
* added clean_angular_template_cache management command to clean case
  manually without executing heavy 'compress' command.

Change-Id: If1fd61fa2e4b36e22797b0f54ac067a2a937f369

commit_message:
Fix django-compress caching issues

django-compress doesn't work well with cache. If horizon is
deployed in a containarized environment with pre-built static
in images, django-compress tries to load old templates from cache.

This patch introduces following changes:

* update_angular_template_hash uses the correct Django cache backend now
* fixed cache cleanup for memcached backend
* added clean_angular_template_cache management command to clean cache
  manually without executing heavy 'compress' command.

Closes-Bug: #1874657
Change-Id: If1fd61fa2e4b36e22797b0f54ac067a2a937f369

commit_message:
Look for python executables in /usr prefix before than other places

This should help solving some problems when looking for
python executable and PATH variable is pointing to '/bin'
folder before than '/usr/bin'

Change-Id: I1a1902c4a356eea36efb85c914794e25b05f83ca

If you were trying to make this absolutely perfect, I think recognizing the sizes of the elements which can be successfully queried, and ignoring the elements which cannot be successfully queried, would be best.

But, I think this falls more under improvement rather than bug. I raised this original concern because it was bailing on a common situation where the directory does not yet exist. For all of the other very strange possibilities, it isn't necessarily clear what it should do, and I would almost prefer to see the error. :-)"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-06-23 05:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Guard against missing image cache directory

The original fix of bug 1878024 missed an edge case where on a fresh
hypervisor the image cache directory hasn't been created yet. That
directory is only created when the first image is downloaded.

This patch makes sure that if the cache dir hasn't been created yet then
0 disk is reserved for the cache usage instead of raising and logging an
exception.

Change-Id: Id1bbc955a9099de1abc11b9063fe177896646d03
Related-Bug: #1878024
Closes-Bug: #1884214

commit_message:
Optimise linear strategy access to physical host variables

Change from using variable manager to the var we already have for
the physical host. This saves nearly 50% time for re-running
playbooks/lxc-container-create.yml

Change-Id: Ic50763f9c74746ef94925a4dd52d16e1f313711b
(cherry picked from commit 871d91cf26bcb95e10ed8805331be31e335afa14)

[{'created': '2020-06-16 21:47:08.000000000', 'message': 'Adding distributed locking to central

The current locking implementation is limited to
the running process. This introduces distributed
locking that will help prevent race conditions
when there are many instances of designate-central
running.

Closes-Bug: #1871332
Change-Id: I98f7f80ce365cdee33528f9964c03274f62a795a

commit_message:
Adding distributed locking to central

The current locking implementation is limited to
the running process. This introduces distributed
locking that will help prevent race conditions
when there are many instances of designate-central
running.

Closes-Bug: #1871332
Change-Id: I98f7f80ce365cdee33528f9964c03274f62a795a
(cherry picked from commit f6090d885c8ebe00a89307a1e2f5621de75dcda8)

When a network port event is recived node and port
lookup is done by MAC address. RPC call is made to
conductor manager process_event().

Conducto process_event() does a lookup in it's event
processors. Only process_network_port_event is
implemented.

process_network_port_event is spawned asynchronously,
it re-validate the node<->port association before it
stores network status from the event in the ports
internal_info field using 'network_status' key.

Since we are likely to recieve events before the node
is in wait state and the node lock is released, the
process_network_port_event method is decorated with
a retry.

Bumps RPC API version to 1.49.

commit_message:
Initial processing of network port events

When a network port event is received node lookup is
done by MAC address to get topic for the node.
RPC call is made to conductor manager process_event().

Conductor process_event() does a lookup in its event
processors mapping. Only process_network_port_event
is implemented.

process_network_port_event is spawned asynchronously,
it re-validate the node<->port association before it
stores network status from the event in the ports
internal_info field using 'network_status' key.

Since we are likely to recieve events before the node
is in wait state and the node lock is released, the
process_network_port_event method is decorated with
a retry.

Bumps RPC API version to 1.49.

Story: 1304673
Task:  29109
Change-Id: I53eaad2e02b3138b0baee9708348451c75e7fac1

commit_message:
WiP - Implement Event Handler in driver interfaces

Event handler is an object processing the events received
on the /events endpoint. Event handler is is defined in
driver interface class‚Äô event_handler field.

The BaseInterface (default) event_handler is None.

Event handlers for network (neutron and flat) handles
network port related events.

Story: 1304673
Task: 29108
Change-Id: I7f8e2beccd88b6e6d40e3ad1d044090742e3376f

commit_message:
Allow to pass global request id in node methods

This change also allows passing ironic API microversion in places
where it was not possible previously, for consistency.

Story: 2007611
Task: 39602
Change-Id: Ib364456c0fa9f09002750131615d97f4f9d0a4de

commit_message:
Stop installing python2.7 on debian/focal

We still require py2 and the lxc library on the host for bionic as
the bionic CI image still has python2 at /usr/bin/python and ansible
interpreter discovery picks that when targetting localhost.

Depends-On: I79b2c72132d7a8e8fe1e06b382ef4de03c05d8b4
Change-Id: Ie94afc5a3c794b1c2be266b6642bc9c74b533287
(cherry picked from commit dfc9502e225efbb0d395f2e450d1474f6e535483)

commit_message:
Differentiate connected and ready hosts

rabbitmq_hosts is used to check which hosts are connected and also
which are ready. Split these into two different methods and update
the existing rabbitmq_hosts to be a wrapper around
rabbitmq_ready_hosts so that when charms build their contexts they
do not include rabbit units which are not ready for client
connections.

Change-Id: Ic8b669fedfef74ed24db733e01c5dfc0fd079abd
Closes-Bug: #1796886

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-18 11:12:10.000000000', 'message': "Make octavia service_auth project configurable

(Renamed and adapted from Switch octavia to use service project in
 service_auth on master and stable/ussuri)

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch to Train and
earlier branches it should be switched to 'admin' to maintain
compatibility.

In Train and earlier, if a deployer keeps the default
'octavia_service_auth_project' of 'admin', the octavia user will be
assigned the admin role in the admin project, as was done previously.
They may also set 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'service' to use the
new behaviour, and avoid a breaking change when later upgrading to
Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)
"}]
commit_message:
Make octavia service_auth project configurable

(Renamed and adapted from Switch octavia to use service project in
 service_auth on master and stable/ussuri)

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch to Train and
earlier branches it should be switched to 'admin' to maintain
compatibility.

In Train and earlier, if a deployer keeps the default
'octavia_service_auth_project' of 'admin', the octavia user will be
assigned the admin role in the admin project, as was done previously.
They may also set 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'service' to use the
new behaviour, and avoid a breaking change when later upgrading to
Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-22 18:21:08.000000000', 'message': "Improve error reporting in password utilities

The kolla-genpwd and kolla-mergepwd commands can be used to manipulate
the kolla passwords.yml file. The format is a YAML encoded dict of
password variable names to their values. If the format is not a dict,
the error messages are unhelpful.  In particular, this can happen if the
file is encrypted e.g. via Ansible Vault.

For kolla-genpwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'items'

For kolla-mergepwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'update'

This change adds a more friendly message.

Change-Id: I27f0835b904e05006ae401adf383090322e1b891
Closes-Bug: #1880220
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error reporting in password utilities

The kolla-genpwd and kolla-mergepwd commands can be used to manipulate
the kolla passwords.yml file. The format is a YAML encoded dict of
password variable names to their values. If the format is not a dict,
the error messages are unhelpful.  In particular, this can happen if the
file is encrypted e.g. via Ansible Vault.

For kolla-genpwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'items'

For kolla-mergepwd:

    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'update'

This change adds a more friendly message.

Change-Id: I27f0835b904e05006ae401adf383090322e1b891
Closes-Bug: #1880220

subject: Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 09:13:46.000000000', 'message': "Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677082/ merged today and moved puppet-rabbitmq to 9.1.0
which is breaking our spec tests:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e767db93fe214514bebc065a64288548/log/job-output.txt

So we error out with things like:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527187 | centos-7 | 1) tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq on redhat-7-x86_64 behaves like tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq should include the base for using certmonger
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527435 | centos-7 | Failure/Error: include ::rabbitmq::params
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527713 | centos-7 | Puppet::PreformattedError:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641
(cherry picked from commit 1e65c3f4fcc7b49c39a26fbe69a58a9677bdd2d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677082/ merged today and moved puppet-rabbitmq to 9.1.0
which is breaking our spec tests:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e767db93fe214514bebc065a64288548/log/job-output.txt

So we error out with things like:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527187 | centos-7 | 1) tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq on redhat-7-x86_64 behaves like tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq should include the base for using certmonger
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527435 | centos-7 | Failure/Error: include ::rabbitmq::params
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527713 | centos-7 | Puppet::PreformattedError:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641
(cherry picked from commit 1e65c3f4fcc7b49c39a26fbe69a58a9677bdd2d0)

commit_message:
Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677082/ merged today and moved puppet-rabbitmq to 9.1.0
which is breaking our spec tests:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e767db93fe214514bebc065a64288548/log/job-output.txt

So we error out with things like:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527187 | centos-7 | 1) tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq on redhat-7-x86_64 behaves like tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq should include the base for using certmonger
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527435 | centos-7 | Failure/Error: include ::rabbitmq::params
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527713 | centos-7 | Puppet::PreformattedError:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641
(cherry picked from commit 1e65c3f4fcc7b49c39a26fbe69a58a9677bdd2d0)

commit_message:
Optimise linear strategy access to physical host variables

Change from using variable manager to the var we already have for
the physical host. This saves nearly 50% time for re-running
playbooks/lxc-container-create.yml

Change-Id: Ic50763f9c74746ef94925a4dd52d16e1f313711b

commit_message:
Do not set client data if not yet clustered

If a unit is not yet clustered then do not send information to
the rabbit clients because the unit is not yet ready for
connections. A fix is also needed on the client side *1 to
gate on recieving data before adding rabbit unit to list
of hosts.

*1 https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/482

Closes-Bug: #1796886
Change-Id: Ib7554bf22356803feb2637a3db3478be575ba350

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 16:02:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the cornercase when $PYTHON is /bin/python3

On some strange corner cases which python 3
could return /bin/python3 instead of /usr/bin/python3

On such cases the value set as alternative for python
command would be invalid.

This fixes such problem by searching from the
valid alternative for desired python
(/usr/bin/python3 or /usr/bin/python3.6)

Change-Id: I1948a87f7d84162fdfe48042710cf5692b969729
'}, {'created': '2020-06-23 04:12:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix the cornercase when $PYTHON is /bin/python3*

CentOS/RHEL 8 only accept /usr/bin/python3 as valid
Python 3 alternatives for 'python' command so that
this enforces setting exactly it.

Change-Id: I1948a87f7d84162fdfe48042710cf5692b969729
"}, {'created': '2020-06-23 04:23:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix the cornercase when $PYTHON is /bin/python3*

commit_message:
Fix the cornercase when $PYTHON is /bin/python3*

CentOS/RHEL 8 only accept /usr/bin/python3 as valid
Python 3 alternatives for 'python' command so that
this enforces setting exactly it.

Change-Id: I1948a87f7d84162fdfe48042710cf5692b969729

Thanks Gustavo for the review. Will update the commit message as part of next patch. Waiting for more comments.'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-01-12 06:17:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The location of isolinux.bin can be set with the config parameter, [DEFAULT]/isolinux_bin. We shouldn't hardcord the path because this location may be different in other distros.

It might be helpful to see if the file exists in __init__() of the virtual media boot interface for detecting the problem earlier.

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 18781, 'date': '2018-01-12 09:18:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > The location of isolinux.bin can be set with the config parameter,
 > [DEFAULT]/isolinux_bin. We shouldn't hardcord the path because this
 > location may be different in other distros.
 > 
 > It might be helpful to see if the file exists in __init__() of the
 > virtual media boot interface for detecting the problem earlier.
 > 
 > Thanks.

Thanks Hironori for the review.
IMO, the creation of ISO is applicable only in cases when partition images are used for vmedia drivers and no way applicable to wholedisk images. So keeping this check in '__init__' of boot interface makes no sense to me."}, {'account_id': 18781, 'date': '2018-01-15 09:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-01-15 09:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Fixes issue with UEFI bootable ISO creation

When virtual media drivers are used to provision the node with partition
images, an ISO is created from the kernel, ramdisk and the provided root
partition which is attached as a URL. The ISO image creation fails on
systems with higher Ubuntu distros(>16.04), since the isolinux.bin, which
is required for ISO creation is not part of 'syslinux' package and requires
'isolinux' package to be installed. This patch makes ironic to search for
the file 'isolinux.bin' in '/usr/lib/ISOLINUX' directory.

Change-Id: Ia3798e72ade0ec922ec75898cd6871020a8a356b
Closes-Bug: #1741439

- dell-hwFX2-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/36/531336/4/check/dell-hwFX2-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool/52e42df/ : SUCCESS in 34m 36s'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-01-09 03:02:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I am concerned this patch will create inconsistency with rules of picking free ports.
get_free_port_like_object prefers ports with pxe_enabled=true, but does not prevent those ports of pxe_enabled=false to be chosen. We can get a situation that port with pxe_enabled=false is used while the node has no way to boot.
I'd prefer filtering out ports not qualified in the rules, to make issues get exposed early."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:17:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I agree with Kaifeng in that the logic differences are a little concerning. Realistically, it is another bug but highly related. get_free_port_like_object might need to be state aware in terms of PXE configuration. That being said, depending on the node configuration, a node could still require network boot operations.

Regardless of which route we take, the minimal single bug or both possible issues at the same time, we're going to need unit tests, and a release note to indicate exactly what has changed behavior wise such that operators are not suddenly surprised if things have been working for them."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-06-25 10:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

inactivity'}]

commit_message:
Create pxe mac link file only pxe_enabled

When doploy a node, ironic create a pxe link file for each port.
If I set a port's pex_enabled property to false, it can still
boot from this port.

Partial-bug: #1741422

Change-Id: I88977043f9d6aaaa55268e31cd2c5372dca0255c

commit_message:
Use btrfs-progs instead of btrfs-tools in functional tests

btrfs-tools is deprecated and replaced by btrfs-progs on modern
debian derivative operating systems.

Change-Id: Iaf5fb24146b7203e879feccc7c96b0984b425d01
(cherry picked from commit 0356fe7407b9573a51a24a22c19cc1297364db20)

commit_message:
Use a single vars file for all ubuntu releases

This adds support for focal without requiring a second vars file.

(cherry picked from commit 1bcea4abcf494ca57adc408569a26a6d7fc24611)

This turned out to have stability issues.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-25 09:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For posterity, the solution used was static routes with the 'onlink' option, such that they can be added to a host without the VIP."}]

[{'created': '2020-06-05 12:55:20.000000000', 'message': "keepalived: support virtual rules and routes

Keepalived supports configuring IP rules and routes on an interface via
'virtual_rules' and 'virtual_routes' options in keepalived.conf. This
can be useful if using policy-based routing, or if required routes are
not routable when a VIP is not active.

https://www.keepalived.org/manpage.html

This change adds supports for specifying virtual rules and routes via
'keepalived_virtual_rules' and 'keepalived_virtual_routes'. It also adds
documentation for these.

Implements: blueprint keepalived-routes-rules

Change-Id: I5c3e659f4db327a44a92c1cbab0690502a5349d1
"}]
commit_message:
keepalived: support virtual rules and routes

Keepalived supports configuring IP rules and routes on an interface via
'virtual_rules' and 'virtual_routes' options in keepalived.conf. This
can be useful if using policy-based routing, or if required routes are
not routable when a VIP is not active.

https://www.keepalived.org/manpage.html

This change adds supports for specifying virtual rules and routes via
'keepalived_virtual_rules' and 'keepalived_virtual_routes'. It also adds
documentation for these.

Implements: blueprint keepalived-routes-rules

Change-Id: I5c3e659f4db327a44a92c1cbab0690502a5349d1

commit_message:
Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

This patch fixes:
- The IPv6 tag added in the "host" file if is supported in
  dnsmasq. That shifts all other parameters in the register.
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address; in this
  case, the method "_read_hosts_file_leases" should return a
  tuple per IP address.

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
(cherry picked from commit 8eb4955bb62ec02b7a5cb725067c6193c37f9b0e)
(cherry picked from commit 68706b556bf5b0f65b418359c3248fe0c778c0c7)

commit_message:
Switch node tests to inherit nodejs-run-test-browser.

Current base of nodjs-npm-run-test is deprecated. We need to switch to
the newer base job to pick up new behavior. Horizon npm tests require
a browser so the job inherit nodejs-run-test-browser now.

In addition, tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
npm jobs in horizon need tox, so we need to install it in pre-run phase.

Change-Id: Iffa3f7631bec0a5f7b0c701df87305725cae5708
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5b67b111ca3dd5b45caf1ef8f2ae8070487a00cc)
(cherry picked from commit ece58b25ddb3754bba744e76ed17aaafae144030)
(cherry picked from commit 5996ae1bd1fa68b8985b49c4a07380d9b723dd4b)

commit_message:
Switch node tests to inherit nodejs-run-test-browser.

Current base of nodjs-npm-run-test is deprecated. We need to switch to
the newer base job to pick up new behavior. Horizon npm tests require
a browser so the job inherit nodejs-run-test-browser now.

In addition, tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
npm jobs in horizon need tox, so we need to install it in pre-run phase.

Change-Id: Iffa3f7631bec0a5f7b0c701df87305725cae5708
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5b67b111ca3dd5b45caf1ef8f2ae8070487a00cc)

When running with Py3 we compare a byte string to a unicode string
when parsing StatsD metrics. This patch adds some unit tests to
reproduce the bug and decodes the bytestring to make the existing
comparisons valid under Py3. When backporting to Train we can use
Oslo encodeutils. Clearly we could have more unit tests, but
this makes a start.

commit_message:
Fix parsing of StatsD metrics with Py3

When running with Py3 we compare a byte string to a unicode string
when parsing StatsD metrics. This patch adds some unit tests to
reproduce the bug and decodes the bytestring to make the existing
comparisons valid under Py3. When backporting to Train we can use
Oslo encodeutils. Clearly we could have more unit tests, but
this makes a start.

Change-Id: I6341f96f5c186428d2d829cabf618a6f84f40ce2
Story: 2007684
Task: 39796

commit_message:
Octavia: handle empty amphora image search result

In some situations, openstack image list queries on name return a 0
exit code even though there is no result.

Note: this differs slightly from the original commit because the linters
are catching a new rule "comparison against empty strings" since the
original commit merged.

Change-Id: I20f63ea45e52181810654f7afab11499fef9baa2
Related-Bug: #1843059
(cherry picked from commit 5fccdd3c2ce9a6259b1b38e950e638ad0b2c46fc)

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Ie846a8cb481da65999b12f5547b407cc7bdc3138

commit_message:
Switch node tests to inherit nodejs-run-test-browser.

Current base of nodjs-npm-run-test is deprecated. We need to switch to
the newer base job to pick up new behavior. Horizon npm tests require
a browser so the job inherit nodejs-run-test-browser now.

In addition, tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
npm jobs in horizon need tox, so we need to install it in pre-run phase.

Change-Id: Iffa3f7631bec0a5f7b0c701df87305725cae5708
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5b67b111ca3dd5b45caf1ef8f2ae8070487a00cc)
(cherry picked from commit ece58b25ddb3754bba744e76ed17aaafae144030)

commit_message:
Ensure pip is installed locally

Recent changes to the base nodepool images removed the system-wide
installation of pip and virtualenv. As a result of this, some
requirements-check jobs are failing with an error that pip could not be
found.

This adds the ensure-pip role as part of pre_tasks in our
requirements-check playbook.

Change-Id: Id4969156383545eb94462677e3321b89c1160b48
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74a5bed896893ecd3bdedb100439f773af7c7f5e)
(cherry picked from commit d303fe350d74d2d40aa5a591ee9d372a529d10be)
(cherry picked from commit d43e0a585719930516fd82504d84e3867512c7f6)

commit_message:
feat(tls): add tls support to services

Part 2 of 2

This patch set enables TLS for the following OpenStack services:
compute kit (nova, neutron and placement). This serves as a
consolidation and clean up patch.

Co-authored-by: sgupta <sg774j@att.com>

Change-Id: I2f7d71d39bb3fb7b346bbe1db923222b6f74b679
Signed-off-by: Tin <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
feat(tls): add tls support to services

Part 1 of 2

This patch set enables TLS for the following OpenStack services:
keystone, horizon, glance, cinder and heat. This serves as a
consolidation and clean up patch for the following:

[0] https://review.opendev.org/733291
[1] https://review.opendev.org/735202
[2] https://review.opendev.org/733962
[3] https://review.opendev.org/733404

This also addresses comments in the existing patch.

Co-authored-by: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737194/
Change-Id: I3564b97df5b73a1bcf144569f5c3318064df419d
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Pin version of designate-tempest-plugin

Master dropped support for py2 but we still need it for some jobs.

Change-Id: Iec79c9cec72e74baab9f002b13d426facff96923

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:16:48.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Fix live migration

After live migrating a volume into the 3PAR driver the volume would be
unusable.  And we would no longer be able to do any operation with it.

Migrated in-use volumes cannot be renamed when migrated and therefore
need to use the "_name_id" field of the Volume object (volumes table in
the DB) to store the original volume's ID so the driver can locate the
volume.

The problem is that, even though the 3PAR driver sets the "_name_id"
field, it doesn't use it for any operation, so once the volume has been
migrated and the ID of the volume no longer matches the one that was
used to create the volume (value now in "_name_id") it will no longer be
able to locate the volume.

This patch adds the logic necessary to locate volumes using the
"_name_id" field.

Closes-Bug: #1697422
Change-Id: I27b9d4be419e1b52db02d4525b292ceeb5d5f867
(cherry picked from commit fc51678298a38dcd94bcfe92c590b38fdb7193e4)
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Fix live migration

After live migrating a volume into the 3PAR driver the volume would be
unusable.  And we would no longer be able to do any operation with it.

Migrated in-use volumes cannot be renamed when migrated and therefore
need to use the "_name_id" field of the Volume object (volumes table in
the DB) to store the original volume's ID so the driver can locate the
volume.

The problem is that, even though the 3PAR driver sets the "_name_id"
field, it doesn't use it for any operation, so once the volume has been
migrated and the ID of the volume no longer matches the one that was
used to create the volume (value now in "_name_id") it will no longer be
able to locate the volume.

This patch adds the logic necessary to locate volumes using the
"_name_id" field.

Closes-Bug: #1697422
Change-Id: I27b9d4be419e1b52db02d4525b292ceeb5d5f867
(cherry picked from commit fc51678298a38dcd94bcfe92c590b38fdb7193e4)

commit_message:
Fix missing tox in functional devstack-minimal based job

At the moment, the functional jobs derived from devstack-minimal does
not make sure tox is present, so the test fails.
This patch adds the role that ensure tox is present.

Change-Id: I9078ac2c4418d4a34cfb53dca8599deb3ec8d5f8

commit_message:
Update  create and delete action for ironic port.

Set create and delete action for ironic port are refused at node is active and maintenance mode is not True.

Change-Id: I0e57b8f3f9c74a2b6dd9f0300dc1ab42beb6309e
Closes-Bug: #1736373

commit_message:
Do not force ceph-ansible/{..} dirs to be ansible_user owned

We shouldn't need to force ownership of the ceph-ansible/{..} dirs
to ansible_user, instead we want those owned by whichever user
is the outer playbook being executed by.

Change-Id: If6bb2ab4d405948255f793980c4cb0b26442747d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-09 05:04:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove query_cache_* out of mysql config

This patch will remove deprecated params in mysql v5.7 [1].
It's also raised error with mysql version 8.0.

[1] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/query-cache.html

Change-Id: I238da75d78f7dff54b3e09327756bfb8fb1f1cd9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove query_cache_* out of mysql config

This patch will remove deprecated params in mysql v5.7 [1].
It's also raised error with mysql version 8.0.

[1] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/query-cache.html

Change-Id: I238da75d78f7dff54b3e09327756bfb8fb1f1cd9

Remove duplicate lint job entry and script

osh-infra currently has a duplicate linter playbook that is not
being used, since the other is used for both osh and osh-infra.
This change removes the duplicate entry and playbook.

Don't you need to set grenade_devstack_localrc.shared.IMAGE_URLS and tempest_test_regex too?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-05-11 12:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to native-zuulv3-migration'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-05-11 12:33:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think both are done when configuring tempest and running the tests explicitly.

https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/devstack/upgrade/resources.sh#L69

We run tempest tests as part of the upgrade process (pre/post) as you can see in[1].

Can we not avoid running it again[2]?

 [1] https://ddbcb83631d115022341-6698722f229587210f5dee93671360ee.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/726790/2/check/grenade-heat/4dce683/controller/logs/grenade.sh_log.txt
[2] https://github.com/openstack/grenade/blob/master/playbooks/grenade.yaml#L36'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-05-12 03:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-05-12 05:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-05-12 09:13:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

No, sorry. I believe it's better to have the post-upgrade non-smoke test be executed by that run-tempest for consistency."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-05-12 09:56:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> No, sorry. I believe it's better to have the post-upgrade non-smoke test be executed by that run-tempest for consistency.

With the tempest regex provided, we would be running the api tests twice after upgrade. Though I've added the regex to run api tests, is there a a way to provide stestr group_regex? Without that api tests in a gabbi file would not be grouped and would fail randomly.

If we can't provide a group_regex we would probably have to provide regex for __a__ non-api test to fake it."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-12 14:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks; please backport it to ussuri, as the grenade job is available there as well.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-25 03:33:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 02:17:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add API to support multiple boot-volumes with boot order selection

We add two API calls to nova-api which are for update and query boot order
of a server. The update request contains the new boot order of volumes, and
a reboot option. After received request, wes ave the new boot index
information to databases, and update server's root device and root device
size. If user set the reboot option to true, then a hard rebooting
invoking will be made.

In the nova-compute module, we modified the "_get_guest_config" method.
Multiple boot support will be used when os boot device is 'hd', and this
os element will be removed. Afterwards, boot order information will be
written into the guest's config based on guest's block device information.
Then the server will boot from the volume as arranged.

Change-Id: I285a088e9224a8b5b9033a2ed4f667ea935f0a63
'}]
commit_message:
Add API to support multiple boot-volumes with boot order selection

We add two API calls to nova-api which are for update and query boot order
of a server. The update request contains the new boot order of volumes, and
a reboot option. After received request, wes ave the new boot index
information to databases, and update server's root device and root device
size. If user set the reboot option to true, then a hard rebooting
invoking will be made.

In the nova-compute module, we modified the "_get_guest_config" method.
Multiple boot support will be used when os boot device is 'hd', and this
os element will be removed. Afterwards, boot order information will be
written into the guest's config based on guest's block device information.
Then the server will boot from the volume as arranged.

Change-Id: I285a088e9224a8b5b9033a2ed4f667ea935f0a63

commit_message:
Add simple readiness probe for cinder-backup pod

Mitigates situation when deployment is considered successful despites
cinder-backup service fails to load driver.
Such way pod is considered ready if service runs consequently for 30s.
Similar checks may be added to any service container that currently
has no readiness probe, especially the ones not covered by testing.

Closes-bug: #1839742
Change-Id: Ic8772abe2156df6609e15034e5895df122e6084a

With multi-cell we can have stacks with no nova-api so the nova database
operations must be coupled to nova-conductor, not nova-api.

Change-Id: I27aa62d00b77ca7ff61bb31c6f396f03e148a144

commit_message:
Move nova online migrations to nova-conductor

With multi-cell we can have stacks with no nova-api so the nova database
operations must be coupled to nova-conductor, not nova-api.

Change-Id: I27aa62d00b77ca7ff61bb31c6f396f03e148a144
Closes-bug: #1883098
(cherry picked from commit 22df3dbcbb67c62dc725c5f76140a10278b4d27b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 01:01:21.000000000', 'message': "Fixes to use the latest centos-8 release image

CentOS Linux 8 (2004) is the current release for CentOS Linux 8[1] and
we can find it in http://cloud.centos.org/centos/8/x86_64/images/ but,
the LATEST_IMAGE_FILE variable in 10-centos-cloud-image doesn't point
to the latest release image but the previous one.

[1] https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2004%C2%A0#Major_Changes

Closes-Bug #1884859

Change-Id: I01d37bca730c752a21afc6a56cd0946bc2467db8
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes to use the latest centos-8 release image

CentOS Linux 8 (2004) is the current release for CentOS Linux 8[1] and
we can find it in http://cloud.centos.org/centos/8/x86_64/images/ but,
the LATEST_IMAGE_FILE variable in 10-centos-cloud-image doesn't point
to the latest release image but the previous one.

[1] https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2004%C2%A0#Major_Changes

Closes-Bug #1884859

Change-Id: I01d37bca730c752a21afc6a56cd0946bc2467db8

commit_message:
[fs062] Enable octavia scenario tests

It enables the full octavia scenario tests and removing
tempest network basic ops tests as it does not provides value in
octavia testing.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735854/

Change-Id: Ibf9648dfdd1241569d7093ac2e0004bd77bf9827
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
objects: Replace 'cpu_pinning_requested' helper

This helper avoided a slightly long-winded check for what was
essentially a binary condition before. With the future introduction of a
'mixed' policy, this isn't always going to be suitable going forward.
Replace it with explicit checks for types.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: If7512c998bca770889d81012a17a1a2978cae68e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Clean up NFS unmount during unstack

Don't run umount run if no shares are mounted, which
reduces umount noise.

Change-Id: Ib062afbdbc2ae0ff773741e29402eb13a925d40e

commit_message:
podman: get cpus allowed list only when isolcpus in cmdline

When building the podman command, only get cpus allowed list when there
is isolcpus in the /proc/cmdline otherwise skip the argument.

Note: re-working the Mocks for cpu affinity so we can properly test the
/proc/cmdline reads.

Change-Id: I270c90d3adc8824991896443c6074f8f7357c942
Related-Bug: #1884765
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7ea9455221148bfdbfcda83fad95a7eca760807b)

This is a train-only patch since later the whole thing was moved out of

Change-Id: Ie1530321b488bef11692553ea25131d9360763dd

commit_message:
[TRAIN ONLY] Do not encode hostnames in validation result

Encoding the names to utf-8 leads to unwanted failures such as:
KeyError: b'undercloud'
as well as
TypeError: sequence item 0: expected str instance, bytes found

Removing the two calls to .encode() solves those issues.

It also correct a tiny deprecation warning, moving from LOG.warn to
LOG.warning.

This is a train-only patch since later the whole thing was moved out of
tripleoclient in favor of validations-libs and/or validations-common.

Change-Id: Ie1530321b488bef11692553ea25131d9360763dd

subject: Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file
messages: [{'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2020-06-24 09:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-06-24 20:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-06-24 09:23:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file

Before this change, the values were set to haproxy defaults,
however, these should not be used. The keystone endpoint
should be verified by the system's default CA certificates,
which are mounted into the neutron_api container.

Change-Id: I35b39a1bc0e1793116831485180a49da5e0a019a
Closes-Bug: #1883741
Resolves: rhbz#1844592
(cherry picked from commit 9befc582571757cfd2bfd45f491617af3d563af8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file

Before this change, the values were set to haproxy defaults,
however, these should not be used. The keystone endpoint
should be verified by the system's default CA certificates,
which are mounted into the neutron_api container.

Change-Id: I35b39a1bc0e1793116831485180a49da5e0a019a

commit_message:
Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file

Before this change, the values were set to haproxy defaults,
however, these should not be used. The keystone endpoint
should be verified by the system's default CA certificates,
which are mounted into the neutron_api container.

Change-Id: I35b39a1bc0e1793116831485180a49da5e0a019a
Closes-Bug: #1883741
Resolves: rhbz#1844592
(cherry picked from commit 9befc582571757cfd2bfd45f491617af3d563af8)

commit_message:
Fix the default values for ca_file and cert_file

Before this change, the values were set to haproxy defaults,
however, these should not be used. The keystone endpoint
should be verified by the system's default CA certificates,
which are mounted into the neutron_api container.

Change-Id: I35b39a1bc0e1793116831485180a49da5e0a019a
Closes-Bug: #1883741
Resolves: rhbz#1844592
(cherry picked from commit 9befc582571757cfd2bfd45f491617af3d563af8)

commit_message:
Add an ironic cross-job with py38

This patch adds an ironic cross-job to help verify requirements
changes.
We need to run that on Ubuntu Focal to have Python 3.8 installed
as default interpreter.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/737362

Change-Id: Ie7ba23f845bc5de2c22da21c54becf6c5a0be0a5

commit_message:
Cleanup all container startup configs before generating the new ones

Unlike the container puppet configs [1], we didn't have a mechanism that
was purging the old configs previously generated by the container
startup config tasks. It's problematic when some leftover configs are
still on the host and not needed anymore.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/container_puppet_config.py#L157-L159

Change-Id: I24dac79f2351a1ffd4e956584a80f623706cbd00
Closes-Bug: #1884537
(cherry picked from commit b1d3da8666880d70db9b588ed4b743b2aaaab914)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 20:40:15.000000000', 'message': 'Identify not allowed parameters in upgrades.

This change allows us identifying a set of parameters which should
not been passed in the upgrade prepare or upgrade converge steps.
As it is now, it is mostly intended to block the converge step
if the FFU parameters (Stein registry parameters)  were left in
the environment files before running the converge step, however
it will allow blocking the upgrade prepare in the case that some
deprecated or not recommended parameter is provided in the templates.

The way how it works is by converting every single yaml passed in
the environment files into a  list of keys (only for the
parameters_default so far), then it will try to intersect the list
of forbidden parameters with the list of keys. If there is a match
an exception will be raised showing those parameters:

ERROR openstack [-] The following parameters should be removed from
the environment files:
ceph3_namespace
name_suffix_stein
tag_stein
name_prefix_stein
ceph3_image
namespace_stein
ceph3_tag

Change-Id: I24715f5e55d4cd6cf9879345980d3a3c5ab8830c

ceph3_namespace
name_suffix_stein
tag_stein
name_prefix_stein
ceph3_image
namespace_stein
ceph3_tag

Change-Id: I24715f5e55d4cd6cf9879345980d3a3c5ab8830c
'}]
commit_message:
Identify not allowed parameters in upgrades.

This change allows us identifying a set of parameters which should
not been passed in the upgrade prepare or upgrade converge steps.
As it is now, it is mostly intended to block the converge step
if the FFU parameters (Stein registry parameters)  were left in
the environment files before running the converge step, however
it will allow blocking the upgrade prepare in the case that some
deprecated or not recommended parameter is provided in the templates.

The way how it works is by converting every single yaml passed in
the environment files into a  list of keys (only for the
parameters_default so far), then it will try to intersect the list
of forbidden parameters with the list of keys. If there is a match
an exception will be raised showing those parameters:

ERROR openstack [-] The following parameters should be removed from
the environment files:
ceph3_namespace
name_suffix_stein
tag_stein
name_prefix_stein
ceph3_image
namespace_stein
ceph3_tag

Change-Id: I24715f5e55d4cd6cf9879345980d3a3c5ab8830c

commit_message:
Add global_request_id into the base client methods

This change also allows passing os_ironic_api_version into create and
delete methods, which was not possible previously.

Story: 2007611
Task: 39602
Change-Id: I28e094df8ca0b1921fb8b6d503e8d09dfff064d7

commit_message:
Allow to pass additional arguments into adapter

This change allows to pass additional_headers and global_request_id
to keystoneauth's Adapter constructor. Also SessionClient now makes
use of them while doing HTTP requests (apart from version negotitaion
requests).

Story: 2007611
Task: 39602
Change-Id: I75cb9311bf44cbf7f6f8737d1d37b2be503be3f9

commit_message:
Use "datetime.datetime.isoformat" instead of "timeutils.isotime"

oslo-utils "isotime" is deprecated [1]. "datetime.datetime.isoformat"
should be used instead.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/382370781bef900fae16687cc83d5e72d6769193/oslo_utils/timeutils.py#L45-L49

(cherry-picked from neutron Iaaab299298c6528ea56e4b212674f492dfe517b7)

Change-Id: I0bc541b1460764407ac753049fb3ba89b7536bc0
Co-Authored-By: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-06-17 22:02:29.000000000', 'message': 'Stop allocating double space for raw images

There are two possibilities when ironic conductor will be converting
instance image to raw format:

1. when iscsi deploy is used and [DEFAULT]force_raw_images config option
   is set to True;
2. when direct deploy is used, [agent]image_download_source config
   option is set to "http" and [DEFAULT]force_raw_images and
   [agent]stream_raw_images config options are set to True.

If one of the above conditions is met, ironic tries to allocate the disk
space needed for conversion even if the image is already raw, basically
doubling the disk space requirements for each image. This change adds a
check that skips the unnecessary conductor disk space allocation attempt
if the image is already raw.

Story: 2007830
Task: 40112
Change-Id: I730f9ec89ff1598d42777e4a503f46316eb85cad

commit_message:
Stop allocating double space for raw images

There are two possibilities when ironic conductor will be converting
instance image to raw format:

1. when iscsi deploy is used and [DEFAULT]force_raw_images config option
   is set to True;
2. when direct deploy is used, [agent]image_download_source config
   option is set to "http" and [DEFAULT]force_raw_images and
   [agent]stream_raw_images config options are set to True.

If one of the above conditions is met, ironic tries to allocate the disk
space needed for conversion even if the image is already raw, basically
doubling the disk space requirements for each image. This change adds a
check that skips the unnecessary conductor disk space allocation attempt
if the image is already raw.

Story: 2007830
Task: 40112
Change-Id: I730f9ec89ff1598d42777e4a503f46316eb85cad

commit_message:
Release blazar-nova for victoria-1 milestone

This is a library release for blazar-nova for the victoria-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I0e500797d5772305b9476b0170eacbc17e1bcf0a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

itself.

commit_message:
Add full download retries

Instead of just trying to get the connection and handler
for the download, lets try to retry the whole action of
of downloading.

Change-Id: I9217792d32e6f33c70f146a9b7d3ef58c5644d8a

subject: Switch node tests to inherit nodejs-run-test-browser.
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 18:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-22 22:34:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Previously nodejs-run-test job installs tox but it is OpenStack-specific requirement as horizon and its plugin install JS libraries via xstatic.
tox was dropped from its dependency recently as npm does not require tox in general. Thus, I think the right approach is to add ensure-tox in 'pre' step as Andreas did for horizon base job [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736992/"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-22 22:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-22 23:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-22 23:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looking at the result of cross-horizon-npm [1], it looks like nodejs-run-test-browser is needed as the test expects a browser.

[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_c82/737351/3/check/cross-horizon-npm/c82d453/job-output.txt'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-22 23:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 23:33:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

+2 for Akihiro's changes (I actually had this as my plan B ;) )"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-06-23 00:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-06-23 02:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-24 20:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit ece58b25ddb3754bba744e76ed17aaafae144030'}]

Current base of nodjs-npm-run-test is deprecated. We need to switch to
the newer base job to pick up new behavior. Horizon npm tests require
a browser so the job inherit nodejs-run-test-browser now.

In addition, tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
npm jobs in horizon need tox, so we need to install it in pre-run phase.

Change-Id: Iffa3f7631bec0a5f7b0c701df87305725cae5708
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch node tests to inherit nodejs-run-test-browser.

Current base of nodjs-npm-run-test is deprecated. We need to switch to
the newer base job to pick up new behavior. Horizon npm tests require
a browser so the job inherit nodejs-run-test-browser now.

In addition, tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
npm jobs in horizon need tox, so we need to install it in pre-run phase.

Change-Id: Iffa3f7631bec0a5f7b0c701df87305725cae5708
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

These addresses are given defaults of 0.0.0.0 in the role defaults
but in a deployment we know which address each service should bind to.

The variable repo_server_bind_address should hold the mgmt network IP
address for either containerised or metal deployments and drives the
bind addresses where necessary.

Co-Authored-By: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
Change-Id: Iff95282b91a94d22fc8f6cdbadefacb53cae5b79

commit_message:
Bind services to mgmt network addresses

These addresses are given defaults of 0.0.0.0 in the role defaults
but in a deployment we know which address each service should bind to.

The variable repo_server_bind_address should hold the mgmt network IP
address for either containerised or metal deployments and drives the
bind addresses where necessary.

Co-Authored-By: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
Change-Id: Iff95282b91a94d22fc8f6cdbadefacb53cae5b79
(cherry picked from commit 1ac51ddea73245a07450c6c0d22590bba3bf4497)

commit_message:
Workaround missing DIB on stable jobs

This should fix Train and Stein jobs failing due to missing DIB.
Probably we can remove this once fixes on Octavia side [1][2] are
merged and ported to Train.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736965/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736824/

Change-Id: I8f5a141704c0a7c2095134c4afce2433e83f9415

commit_message:
Fix missing params in amphora base and noop driver

Running amphora failover against the amphora noop driver was raising a
TypeError (reload() takes from 2 to 3 positional arguments but 4 were
given).

Change-Id: I64172d6995959cf377364584ad9a2395f9ec0605

commit_message:
WIP: Add libvirt RBD configuration doc

We are currently missing a doc about configuring RBD for libvirt/KVM
compute nodes. Given how common that is, we probably should. Further,
the recent work to enable multiple backend stores needs a place where
we can lay out the how and why of that.

This adds general KVM RBD doc and fills in the multistore bits, but
still needs some of the more general content to be useful.

Related to blueprint rbd-glance-multistore

Change-Id: I99306aedb7750f03a4ee3215ee7a59d96c6fa40b

[{'created': '2020-06-17 15:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add Paramaters to httpd.conf template

Added the following parameters to the httpd.conf template
to be used with mod_auth_openidc Apache mod. Params include:
- OIDCStateMaxNumberOfCookies - this takes parameters in the form
<number> <false|true> where number is the maximum number of state
cookies stored in parallel for outstanding auth requests, and the
boolean indicates whether cookies that are still valid over this
amount are deleted
- OIDCDefaultURL - Defines a default URL to be used in case of
3rd-party or OP initiated SSO when no explicit target_link_uri has
been provided. The user is also sent to this URL is in case an
invalid authorization response was received
(ref: https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf)

The reason these have been added is due to some stability issues
that have been seen regarding cached session cookies that subsequently
cause a "state mismatch" error. Being able to limit the number of active cookies
appears to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: Id2248e93f2636407396d4ac8fe29c8943e4a3a57
'}, {'created': '2020-06-17 17:31:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add Paramaters to httpd.conf template

commit_message:
Add Paramaters to httpd.conf template

Added the following parameters to the httpd.conf template
to be used with mod_auth_openidc Apache mod. Params include:
- OIDCStateMaxNumberOfCookies - this takes parameters in the form
<number> <false|true> where number is the maximum number of state
cookies stored in parallel for outstanding auth requests, and the
boolean indicates whether cookies that are still valid over this
amount are deleted
- OIDCDefaultURL - Defines a default URL to be used in case of
3rd-party or OP initiated SSO when no explicit target_link_uri has
been provided. The user is also sent to this URL is in case an
invalid authorization response was received
(ref: https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf)

The reason these have been added is due to some stability issues
that have been seen regarding cached session cookies that subsequently
cause a "state mismatch" error. Being able to limit the number of active cookies
appears to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: Id2248e93f2636407396d4ac8fe29c8943e4a3a57

[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-06-23 22:23:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-06-23 22:28:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This should probably be a new config file that is specific to openstack and can be applied to openstack's retired projects independent of others. 

As suggested on IRC another option is to create a new retired.config we can apply to all the other non openstack retired projects as this file is already in the openstack/ dir."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-06-23 22:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-23 22:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This looks right, but will still require a manual script of API calls to switch these repos back to active state before manage-projects will be able to apply it.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-06-23 23:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> This looks right, but will still require a manual script of API
 > calls to switch these repos back to active state before

hope that can be done once this is merged instead of waiting for next project rename schedule?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-06-24 00:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-24 00:20:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Yes, it can be done without downtime, it's just that the current read-only state prevents our normal ACL/config update automation from being able to push the state change into the repository. It can be done live via the Gerrit API, and I'm happy to do it once this merges."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-24 05:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

why is this needed? How will this be used?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-24 12:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The idea is that the TC (or later some group to whom they delegate this responsibility) can still push cleanup changes if OpenStack decides on further changes to its retirement process in the future and wants to retroactively apply those adjustments to already retired repositories in the openstack namespace.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-24 12:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Jeremy, thanks for explanation. I now read the #openstack-tc discussion as well.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-06-24 13:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-24 14:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-06-24 17:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
gerrit: change retired.config acls

This patch updates the retired.config ACL to allow for the technical
commitee to be able to push changes into the repositories which are
retired.

The ACLs allows tech-committee group members to set all labels onto
changes as well as allowing them exclusive rights to push (therefore not
allowing any other members) and giving them access to submit changes (in
order to skip our gating).

The goal is to evenutally replace this group by another one once the
ACLs are verified to be working.

Change-Id: Ia6d516621ec405b02f3f97340d96d9938b605d8f

commit_message:
remove ansible_python_interpreter

ansible_python_interpreter is now set to auto in the tests repo.
it doesn't need to be overwritten in the test anymore.

Change-Id: I27da99b0ec5fe309b1bb19e073f4ab89502b000e
(cherry picked from commit 52953f08c5a0b3f9f78a293f6620afa45ba7afa9)

commit_message:
Fix the name of the renamed network for trove

The change I60e6126a9fc0ca5c51009fb207642ce2c1afa323 brings the issue with
fail in the translations scenario during the trove configuration. This change
renames the flat network for trove in order to match the required flat name
that is dbaas-mgmt.

Change-Id: I4066d74d3547343929d5208fb453732786b36948
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

subject: Disable Fluentd Monasca plugin retry limit
messages:
[{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-09 10:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Didn't we decide not to backport this?"}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-06-15 09:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think this is a separate bug to https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1855700 (which we decided not to backport). The commit message no longer fully applies since we do not write logs to file. It looks like the default queue lengths (https://docs.fluentd.org/v/0.12/buffer#buffer_queue_limit) should limit the maximum number of logs buffered to memory to 2GB(?), which seems reasonable, but will no doubt increase the risk of running out of memory particularly on nodes like hypervisors. I think it may be best to avoid back porting it because of the increased risk of memory starvation affecting users. At least the logs will still be available locally. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-06-22 05:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-06-24 16:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Shall we abandon this?'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-24 17:22:21.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Not quite sure why we wouldn't want a bug fix, but if you say so"}]

[{'created': '2020-06-05 13:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Disable Fluentd Monasca plugin retry limit

By default a retry limit of 17 exists. When the limit is reached buffered
logs are discarded. To avoid this, we disable the retry limit. The risk of
bringing down the host by filling the Fluent data docker volume is managed
by the maximum buffer size which is 2GB by default.

In summary, after this change, the net behaviour is that Fluentd should
buffer up to a maximum of 2GB of logs locally, and attept to post them to
the Monasca Log API at intervals not exceeding 30 minutes.

Closes-Bug: #1855702
Change-Id: I0d5a3dab29635c00411f4f51e5a0721726df2abd
(cherry picked from commit f19eb7de88b27a5476e202affe36d1bf1f028f98)

commit_message:
Disable Fluentd Monasca plugin retry limit

By default a retry limit of 17 exists. When the limit is reached buffered
logs are discarded. To avoid this, we disable the retry limit. The risk of
bringing down the host by filling the Fluent data docker volume is managed
by the maximum buffer size which is 2GB by default.

In summary, after this change, the net behaviour is that Fluentd should
buffer up to a maximum of 2GB of logs locally, and attept to post them to
the Monasca Log API at intervals not exceeding 30 minutes.

Closes-Bug: #1855702
Change-Id: I0d5a3dab29635c00411f4f51e5a0721726df2abd
(cherry picked from commit f19eb7de88b27a5476e202affe36d1bf1f028f98)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Rep validation fix & Retype suspension fix

Moved replication status validation call into create_rep_enabled_volume
lower in _create_volume which has additional locking based on
array+storage group to prevent race condition with multiple
create volume requests.
Added additional resume rdfg call during retype as when moving
from from rep_enabled to another rep_enabled type the original
storage group was being left in a suspended state.

Closes-Bug: 1875433
Change-Id: I8a52d67cea80a5a4eb03f25a0913b1ba6cc24b3a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 12:19:52.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ic0d8c9e1025cd05f4042f1c5ba440cc03a0b5834
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ic0d8c9e1025cd05f4042f1c5ba440cc03a0b5834

[{'created': '2020-06-18 14:52:41.000000000', 'message': 'Display name in IDP dropdown

If an operator would like a different display name
on the horizon Identity Provider dropdown to the one used
for their IDP in the backend they may specify a display_name
in their entry within the keystone_sp.trusted_idp_list.
Otherwise this continues to default to the IDPs name as usual.

Change-Id: Iba8c6e6b66480cdd575f75162c9be80e84ec868b

commit_message:
Display name in IDP dropdown

If an operator would like a different display name
on the horizon Identity Provider dropdown to the one used
for their IDP in the backend they may specify a display_name
in their entry within the keystone_sp.trusted_idp_list.
Otherwise this continues to default to the IDPs name as usual.

Change-Id: Iba8c6e6b66480cdd575f75162c9be80e84ec868b

Socket read operations can be blocking and may not timeout as
expected, so we need to have additional guard rails to detect and
respond to these odd situations.

Change-Id: I7214fc9dbd903789c9e39ee809f05454aeb5a240

'}, {'created': '2020-06-16 22:11:39.000000000', 'message': "Add timeout operations to try and prevent hang on read()

Socket read operations can be blocking and may not timeout as
expected when thinking of timeouts at the beginning of a
socket request. This can occur when streaming file contents
down to the agent and there is a hard connectivity break.

In other words, we could be in a situation like:

- read(fd, len) - Gets data
- Select returns context to the program, we do things with data.
** hard connectivity break for next 90 seconds**
-  read(fd, len) - We drain the in-memory buffer side of the socket.
-  Select returns context, we do things with our remaining data
** Server retransmits **
** Server times out due to no ack **
** Server closes socket and issues a FIN,RST packet to the client **
** Connectivity restored, Client never got FIN,RST **
** Client socket still waiting for more data **
- read(fd, len) - No data returned
- Select returns, yet we have no data to act on as the buffer is
  empty OR the buffered data doesn't meet our requried read len value.
  tl;dr noop
- read(fd, len) <-- We continue to try and read until the socket is
                    recognized as dead, which could be a long time.

NOTE: The above read()s are python's read() on an contents being
      streamed. Lower level reads exist, but brains will hurt
      if we try to cover the dynamics at that level.

As such, we need to keep an eye on when the last time we
received a packet, and treat that as if we have timed out
or not. Requests periodically yeilds back even when no data
has been received, in order to allow the caller to wall
clock the progress/status and take appropriate action.

When we exceed the timeout time value with our wall clock,
we will fail the download.

Change-Id: I7214fc9dbd903789c9e39ee809f05454aeb5a240

commit_message:
Add timeout operations to try and prevent hang on read()

Socket read operations can be blocking and may not timeout as
expected when thinking of timeouts at the beginning of a
socket request. This can occur when streaming file contents
down to the agent and there is a hard connectivity break.

In other words, we could be in a situation like:

- read(fd, len) - Gets data
- Select returns context to the program, we do things with data.
** hard connectivity break for next 90 seconds**
-  read(fd, len) - We drain the in-memory buffer side of the socket.
-  Select returns context, we do things with our remaining data
** Server retransmits **
** Server times out due to no ack **
** Server closes socket and issues a FIN,RST packet to the client **
** Connectivity restored, Client never got FIN,RST **
** Client socket still waiting for more data **
- read(fd, len) - No data returned
- Select returns, yet we have no data to act on as the buffer is
  empty OR the buffered data doesn't meet our requried read len value.
  tl;dr noop
- read(fd, len) <-- We continue to try and read until the socket is
                    recognized as dead, which could be a long time.

NOTE: The above read()s are python's read() on an contents being
      streamed. Lower level reads exist, but brains will hurt
      if we try to cover the dynamics at that level.

As such, we need to keep an eye on when the last time we
received a packet, and treat that as if we have timed out
or not. Requests periodically yeilds back even when no data
has been received, in order to allow the caller to wall
clock the progress/status and take appropriate action.

When we exceed the timeout time value with our wall clock,
we will fail the download.

Change-Id: I7214fc9dbd903789c9e39ee809f05454aeb5a240

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 15:36:26.000000000', 'message': 'Make tox global for update proposal jobs

If00afb50c37b45aefbb45070da4efef3e43e62b2 updated the requirements
update job to use tox as part of the update checking script. We have
ensure-tox as one of the roles in the pre playbook for this job, but it
is not set to be made available globally, which results in the script
failing with being unable to find tox.

This updates the role inclusion to set ensure_global_symlinks: true so
tox will be available in the script.

Change-Id: I5d3ed4ce62cd8df604802fedf522d644d5664698
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make tox global for update proposal jobs

If00afb50c37b45aefbb45070da4efef3e43e62b2 updated the requirements
update job to use tox as part of the update checking script. We have
ensure-tox as one of the roles in the pre playbook for this job, but it
is not set to be made available globally, which results in the script
failing with being unable to find tox.

This updates the role inclusion to set ensure_global_symlinks: true so
tox will be available in the script.

Change-Id: I5d3ed4ce62cd8df604802fedf522d644d5664698
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Also enabled the hacking check that should have caught this, it
was missing from tox.ini along with most of the other in-tree
hacking checks we have added over the years.

Change-Id: Id91175d0db8b8edc72f0dd98925ddbf7415bb881
